name: Sheraton Maldives Full Moon Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first trip to Maldives in May 2007. We were of the impression that it will be very stormy and we expected to stay indoors mostly. Thankfully, the weather held up fine and there was no clouds and rain for all 3 days we were there. Water was clear and plenty of the marine life you would expect from Maldives.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.liked: — Attentive staff and sufficiently private space

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the cottage-style bungalow with outdoor shower/bath - very quaint and nice. Full Moon didn't disappoint with their attentive staff. One thing though is to remember to bring your own toothpaste and brush - you have to buy at their giftshop should you forget these toiletries. And bring lots of insect repellent - mosquitos aplenty and many centipedes as well.
reviews.title: Oh Maldives...

likes.liked: — The fact that it affords beatiful view of sunsets and that it is right over the lagoon.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all - it is a good resort to stay for your first visit to Maldives as it is also only 15 mins from the airport. How many resorts will grant you free access to a room for showering on your last day?
reviews.title: heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at Full Moon Resort from 2nd to 6th June and LOVED every minute of it. We stayed at the water bungalow room number 142 which is the third cluster of water bungalows and it's the nearest one to the Spa. (You can see it in Google Earth!). The water bungalow is amazing! It took our breath away when we first entered it. The porch leads right into the lagoon and we swam everyday BEFORE breakfast! When we were there, high tide was at noon when the current was a bit too strong for weak swimmers, so the best time for a bit of swimming and snorkelling was in the morning. Our water bungalow faced the west so we experienced beautiful sunsets every day that we were there...We saw reef sharks, rays and a myriad of fish right in front of our bungalow! And yes...take some bread from breakfast to feed the fish! Upon the adivise of some the guys here, we brought our own snorkels and masks. And aqua shoes are a must! I only wore 2 kinds of shoes there, my sandals and the aqua shoes...We experienced our first ever full moon moonrise when we had our dinner at Atoll Grill which is on the eastern side of the island. That alone made our trip worth it! I have so much more to tell, I'll continue later...
reviews.title: A definitive review of the island...

likes.liked: — One of the most beautiful places in the world - but i'm sure there are better islands in the Maldives
likes.disliked: — Hideously overpriced services to a captive audience - take double the spending money you think you'll need

reviews.text: Here's an ode to the Maldives...
reviews.title: Lovely Island and Accommodation

likes.liked: — beach front cottages very spacious with fresh modern decor

reviews.text: I stayed at the Full Moon this past September 2 thru 7th for five nights in 2006 and absolutely loved it. It was beyond what I had expected. I was coming from New Delhi and my flight was delayed for an hour (i connected through Sri Lanka) therefore, I didn't arrive at the resort till almost 3AM. Upon my arrival, I was met by a gracious lady who immediately welcomed me with a hot towel and a cold glass of orange juice. She quickly checked me in and drove me to my villa. (they use electric vehicles to take you to your room). She even loan me her cigarette lighter for me to use.
reviews.title: A Gem and a Pearl!

likes.disliked: — the unexpected 10% service charge on everthing!

reviews.title: fantastic time!
reviews.text: I woke up the following day to the reality of true paradise. I was awe-struck by the beauty that was before me. (lush palm trees, blue-green turquoise waters and beautiful blue skies)

reviews.title: awful experience!
reviews.text: Let's start with my fabulous, spacious room. I booked a beach front villa (room 211) and boy was it big. The decor was modern/contemporary with all the expected amenities. There was a queen size bed, an armoire with satellite TV and a CD player with speakers (so bring your favorite cd's to listen to). There was a large couch againts the wall with a beautiful coffee table to allow for visitors to sit down. There was a secretary/desk to the side of the couch with a vanity mirror. The floors were a beautiful ceramic tile. There was a mini bar w/ refrigerator stocked with all sorts of beverages (from sodas to alcoholic ones, complimentary coffee and tea) All the windows (and French doors) had shutters and beautiful fabric furnishings for extra privacy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, let me start off by saying that the Maldives is an extremely beautiful place....but one thing we realized during this vacation is that your accomidations can make or break your vacation. I will start of with what we liked about Full Moon. It is a beautiful resort with clear blue water and the food is good. Unfortunately, we have more things about the Full Moon that we didn't like. We were there for 5 days and went Nov 06, the "dry" season and it rained on and off the entire trip. With that being said, if it is raining, there is nothing to do on the resort. They don't offer indoor activities. We made our reservations with the hotel directly, so after flying all day and arriving at the resort at 11:00PM, they would not let us go to our room without paying the bill FIRST. We found that to be very irritating and very unaccomidating. We had half board which includes breakfast and dinner. The dinner was good but the breakfast got a little old because the menu never changed. We ate lunch at one of the local restaruants and it was very expensive; a hamburger with fries cost $15.00 (that was the cheapest spot). Oh yeah, and we had to buy our water at dinner! We found that the service was slow and everything has a 10% surcharge, which is the tip. So, for dinner, we bought a large bottle of water to go with our meal for $4.00 and paid $.40 in a tip. We had an overwater bungalow and unfortunatly couldn't really swim much outside our bungalow. The water was shallow and rocky. The best (and pretty much the only beach) was on the other side where the beach bungalows were. One evening we went into one of the bars and noticed several people in the bar and some food. We walked up to the bar and about to order a drink when someone on the staff came up to us and started making small talk. He eventually got to his point by telling us it was a privat party and that everyone there was invited. So, we got the hint and left. Since this bar was 1 of 2 bars and they advertised that bar being open for happy hour, we found that to be very classless. For what we were paying, we expected to be pampered and we weren't. The hotel offers no incentives for those who rent pricer rooms, like the overwater bungalows. Before we arrived at the Maldives, we spent a few days in Cambodia (Siem Reap) staying at the Le Meridian. We were spoiled there with the service we received and the "freebies" that came with our room (like free internet access, complementary drinks etc). We got nothing like that at the Full Moon - you literally get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Beautiful...but not what we were expecting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed at the Full Moon for 3 days and 2 nights over Christmas and we generally had an enjoyable time.
reviews.title: A little disappointed...
Full Moon is great.
reviews.text: First, the positives. We stayed at a water bungalow (Room 124) which was absolutely gorgeous. Even though it was cloudy and rained an entire day while we were there, we didn't mind lounging in our water bungalow reading books and watching TV.

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: The spa is also absolutely fabulous, with well trained masseuses (we both got massages from Indonesian masseuses). The massage rooms overlook the beach and there is a glass enclosed relaxation room that is great to waste away the time both before and after your massage. The spa is on a separate island which is real nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately, there were quite a few negatives, which did not bother us that much while we were there, but as they kept adding up, it definitely affected our stay negatively:
reviews.title: Pure Paradise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort - A short speed boat ride from the capital, the resort is beautiful all round, despite the fact it suffered damaged when the Tsunami struck. Our arrival and transfer to our accommodation was quick, easy and handled very well.
reviews.title: No complaints

likes.liked: — Outdoor shower, beachside hut, seclusion of island

reviews.text: The Accommodation - We had one of the Water Bungalows which were newly built after the previous ones had been destroyed by the Tsunami. They are furnished beautifully, they are spacious and the bathroom is lovely although watch out for the glass doors - I walked into them a couple of times in the morning when I was still half asleep! The views out over the ocean were breathtaking. I would recommend you try to get one of the first row of Bungalows. There are steps right down into the water and we were second from the very end where it is rather rocky but the first rows had a beautiful crystal clear waters for descending into.
reviews.title: Overpriced, diving is trashed, staff is poor

likes.liked: — great rooms with outdoor bathrooms and showers

reviews.title: clinical
reviews.text: The Food - We booked Full Board and I was more than happy with the food. We heard some people complaining but I really couldn't see any problem. Some nights it was all-buffet style and other nights it was part buffet with your waiter giving you choices from that days menu. Full board take their meals in the main restaurant. there was always a good choice and the deserts looked as gorgeous as they tasted! The New Year Gala Dinner was amazing - there was every type of food imagineable from Lobster, Suckling Pig, Curries, Salads, A huge BBQ with all types of meat and fish - I cant think of anything that wasn't there! The Ice Sculptures were incredible - the amount of work that went into the whole event was immense.

We (my husband, myself and two teenage sons) have just returned from a relaxed week's holiday at Full Moon Resort, Male, and it's been lovely. It was difficult to decide at first, because everything in the Maldives sounds so good -- so I must thank Trip Advisor members for their honest reviews which helped a lot!
reviews.title: A very relaxed holiday

likes.liked: — well-run, efficient and of a hgh quality
likes.disliked: — patchy service at times, the service charge and food and drink prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Facilities: Right from the air-conditioned speedboat which takes you to the resort, to the quick check in and well-appointed rooms, the experience was very good. We stayed at a water bungalow, and while the coral on that side of the island isn't that good from the snorkelling viewpoint, there's a lot of marine life there -- baby sharks and trigger fish swim around your room and you can jump right from your bedroom into the sea! From what I saw, the beach bungalows look lovely too. Our bathroom had a big glass window next to the bathtub, which overlooked the sea! That was special.
reviews.title: Paradise!
WONDERFUL GARDENS
reviews.text: The Anchorage Bar at sunset was amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service: Very good, with a couple of patchy spots. I got the impression they were a bit short of staff, especially at the Anchorage Bar where we had to do much of our own fetching and carrying. The rooms were done quite well twice a day, but what was irritating a bit was the fact that there's no complimentary water in the rooms, save the first bottle.(This is the custom in most hotels.) At $4 a bottle it's a bit of a rip off. So's the food quite pricey, but the staff is friendly and polite and many go out of their way to help. The 10 per cent service charge is irritating, but again, we were forwarned. Slapping it on purchases at the inhouse boutique was a bit much, I thought!
reviews.title: We can't wait to go back

likes.disliked: — Too many light switches to turn off.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: We took half-board, which can get a little monotonous dining at the same restaurant if you're there a while, but the food quality is good. The breakfast is standard big hotel buffet -- everything from bacon and eggs to croissants and fruit. Dinner was four-course set menu, catering for the European palate -- mild and safe. The wines were pretty expensive. The Bushman's Gully semillon chardonnay was the best bet at $24 -- thanks very much to other TA reviewers who tipped us off!
reviews.title: Fantastic Honeymoon at Full Moon

likes.liked: — Overwater Bungalow with Bath Tub overlooking the ocean, very romantic!

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: This is a good hotel.... the food is soooooooooooo rich & tasty!!!! the staff is very helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at FM from 9 to 19 February. We wanted somewhere quiet to relax on a beach and enjoy good food and accommodation. We like the sea, but are not strong swimmers and only beginners at snorkelling. FM had not been our first or second choice in Maldives, but they were not available. When we booked we looked up the resort on TA and felt positive. Then, having checked the most recent reviews before departure, we began to have reservations. When you read some of the reviews pre-dating this one you will see why. We wondered what to expect - things going wrong, bad food, poor service? Had we made a good choice?
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations? Yes!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We need not have worried. Although we were apprehensive, the resort did indeed exceed our expectations.
reviews.title: Amazing Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: FLIGHT - We flew with Sri Lankan. Reasonable comfort, good food and pleasant service. Return was via Colombo, and we were switched to Emirates which was excellent. Return from Colombo was reasonable - not quite as comfortable as going out, and wouldn't it have been nice to get a hot drink during the long gap between lunch and dinner.
reviews.title: Beautiful Island and a Mixed bag of reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TRANSFER was excellent. - Straight out to the hotel's desk then to the speedboat for cold towels and water, and a short exhilirating ride to FM, to be greeted with a fruit drink and more towels on check-in, then whisked off in the buggy to our beach cottage.
reviews.title: Not worth the money

likes.disliked: — Nowhere decent to snorkel. Not being able to sleep because of noise.

aka: Sheraton Maldives Full Moon Hotel North Male Atoll
description: Sheraton Maldives Full Moon Resort & Spa is situated on it's own private island surrounded by tropical landscaping and turquoise lagoons. With 176 guest rooms reflecting the tropical destination featuring the Sheraton Sweet Sleeper Bed. Facing the sunrise with spectacular views of the Indian Ocean are 20 Ocean Villas offer large bathrooms, comfortable living spaces and luxurious outdoor living areas complete with infinity edge plunge pools.Sheraton Maldives is just a 15-minute boat ride from Malé International Airport.
